data.title: CCleaner vs BleachBit
data.meta_description:

data.text:
Hi

Since the past few days I went through few articles stating that Ccleaner has been infected with some sort of Malware, I don’t know at present its impact i.e. how dangerous it is and how much computers has been infected all over the world.

Therefore I have just checked some alternatives of CCleaner and I have just find a software named ‘BleachBit’.

Has anyone used BleachBit ? If so then please share your reviews…

Also suggest some real good alternatives of CCleaner

P.S. I don’t trust Adv. System Cleaner, TuneUp Utilities as they keep coming up with Adwares.

What features of CCleaner do you regularly use?

Knowing this will help narrow down some alternatives.

Personally I usually just use it for disk cleanup, I don’t mess with registry “cleaners” or disk wiping inside of Windows.

PS: The malware slipped into one of the update servers affecting 32bit installations. It was stopped before any damage was done and a new version update was pushed ASAP.

I’ve been using BleachBit for a while - I think it’s helpful. When I install it on a computer it also copies a configuration file with the default settings that I defined, so the users don’t have to figure out which boxes to check.

Neither? I prefer opensource or paid tools I can vet. Definitely something with posted hashes of the download and companies with a long history of success.

That said, I don’t use these quick fix it tools. Built in Windows tools and manual/your scripted cleanup are better options because you know what changes are being made.
